title: How we write the report on survey of one child? - Quora

response.answer_text: Writing a report for a child is not a tedious task but not a child's play... The purpose for writing g the report must be clear to you.. I hoping that the same has been established hence I'm not digging dip into it. Before you write a report you must observe the child well... Take into account his daily behaviour ,activities, interests,responses,personality etc. Once you've done this start by giving a brief sketch of the child which would comprise of his basic traits and features... Then you talk about what you observed and the conclusions based on it you may also give your suggestions but restrict yourself from filling pages with suggestions... Remember it's just a report. Always start with something positive and then slowly unfurl the negatives, if any. I repeat the report should be based on your observation not on your judgements
